oai_dc:dc.dc:title: QUANTIFICATION OF LONGSHORE SAND TRANSPORT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yeend, John S.
Hatheway, Darryl J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: longshore transport
sediment transport
transport quantification
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The intent of this paper is to express the quantities of sand bypassed by a sand transfer facility and transported in the littoral drift at the South Lake Worth Inlet, Palm Beach County, Florida. Discussion on littoral transport volumes will include estimates of the annual average drift from 1948 to 1987, and discussions of sand bypassing quantities will include improvements in the estimation of pumping rates.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 205
